author: providencejournal.com
title: Berkeley Film Festival's documentary winner screening at Brown - Entertainment & Life
text: PROVIDENCE, R.I. -- Brown University's Department of Literary Arts will present a screening of the documentary film "Language Matters with Bob Holman" on Tuesday, Oct. 27, at noon in the McCormack Family Theater, 70 Brown St., Providence. The film is winner of the Berkeley Film Festival's 2015 Documentary of the Year award. Following the screening, Holman with talk about the film's focus: the threat to and resilience of language diversity in a era of globalization. Holman, the author of 16 poetry collections, is a co-founder of the Endangered Language Alliance. The event is free and open to the public; for more information go to brown.edu/cw .
